Advancing Accessibility for First Nations Communities on Reserve

### Background and Purpose

The Government of Canada has launched a new tender announcement to advance accessibility for First Nations Communities on Reserve. The Employment and Skills Development Canada (ESDC) is seeking the services of a research organization to conduct research activities in collaboration with individual First Nations communities or First Nations regional organizations.

### Requirements

The objective of this project is to analyze options for pursuing distinct First Nations accessibility legislation, develop recommendations related to the creation of a First Nations-led accessibility assessor training program, and provide insights into existing mechanisms used to gather data on disabilities prevalent on reserve and related accessibility concerns.

The successful bidder will be required to:

* Conduct national engagement with First Nations governments and regional organizations (Year 1)
* Develop results and findings (Year 2)

### Contract Details

* Estimated Contract Value: $198,390
* Contract Period: January 2023 – March 31, 2023 (Year 1), April 2023 – September 2023 (Year 2)
* Notice Type: Advance Contract Award Notice
* Procurement Method: Competitive – Open Bidding
